title: Kate Waterhouse shows off her incredibly toned calves in a pink dress at the Epsom Races
text:
She's the Australian racing heiress with an expensive taste in high fashion.

And on Saturday, Kate Waterhouse put on a very leggy display in a bold magneta dress at the Epsom Races at Sydney's Royal Randwick Racecourse.

The 36-year-old mother-of-two stood out from the crowd with very oversized puffy sleeves on her frock, paired with a statement black veil.

Legs to die for! Kate Waterhouse (pictured) showed off her incredibly toned calves in a pink dress with oversized puffy sleeves at the Epsom Races on Saturday

Kate's trim pins were on full display in the thigh-cut frock from Australian designer Camilla and Marc.

She accentuated her incredibly toned calves with pair of Christian Louboutin high heels, which were black with glamorous silver detailing.

The experimental dress also featured a contrasting snakeskin print on the hips, which perfectly matched her luxurious Fendi purse.

Stunner: The 36-year-old mother-of-two stood out from the crowd with very oversized puffy sleeves on her frock, paired with a statement black veil

Homegrown: Kate's trim pins were on full display in the thigh-cut frock from Australian designer Camilla and Marc

The blonde stunner wore her locks in a straight bob, tying in nicely with her Nerida Winter veil and simple makeup palette, highlighting her natural beauty.

Kate was reporting from the event on behalf of Channel 7 Racing and interviewed other fashionistas such as Rebecca Vallance and hat designer Ann Shoebridge.

The fashion journalist and blogger also interviewed other some of her Seven colleagues such as Home and Away's Luke Jacobz and Bride and Prejudice stars.

Simple chic: The blonde stunner wore her locks in a straight bob, tying in nicely with her Nerida Winter veil and simple makeup palette, highlighting her natural beauty

If you've got it, flaunt it! She accentuated her incredibly toned calves with pair of Christian Louboutin high heels, which were black with glamorous silver detailing

Call her salad... because she's dressing! The experimental dress also featured a contrasting snakeskin print on the hips, which perfectly matched her luxurious Fendi purse

At one point, Kate even interviewed her own mother Gabriel 'Gai' Waterhouse, who is a renowned horse trainer married to racing identity Robbie Waterhouse.

Taking to her Instagram story after the event, Kate documented watching herself on television with her daughters Sophia, four, and Grace, two.

'Home in time to see the end of the Seven Horse racing coverage. And we spotted GG (Gai Waterhouse)!,' she captioned one clip.

In the adorable video, young Grace says 'it's you... and GG!' as she recognised both her mother and grandmother on the screen.
